content: you know… for the guys that don t want brims folds tassels pompoms post ridges hat single_crochet hat christmas earflap hat the basic guy hat by jen spears crocheter of awesome based on the built for speed beanie changing up stitches and changing colors to give them a little personality and still be the one they grab most often patterns are written for l/xl but can be adjusted for size using the appendix don t worry i ve done the math for these hats i used 150-175 yards soft worsted yarn like caron simply soft fold up brim needs closer to 200 yards earflap hat - needs closer to 250 yards h/5mm hook using the appendix for sizing you can use any yarn with an appropriately sized hook step by step post ridges hat in double_crochet join each round with a slip st and begin each with a chain 3 round 1 using main color 12dc in ring use magic loop or chain3 and 11dc into first chain round 2 fpdc around post below ch3 *double_crochet in next st fpdc around post below the same st* around end at 24dc round 3 fpdc around post below ch3 *double_crochet in next two st fpdc around fpdc below* around end at 36 double_crochet in other words work your last double_crochet into the top of your join in the row below round 4 fpdc around post below ch3 *double_crochet in next three st fpdc around fpdc below* around end at 48 double_crochet round 5 fpdc around post below ch3 *double_crochet in next four st fpdc around fpdc below* around end at 60 double_crochet round 6 fpdc around post below ch3 *double_crochet in next five st fpdc around fpdc below* around end at 72 double_crochet round 7 *double_crochet in next two st fpdc around post or fpdc below* around 72 double_crochet round 8 11 repeat round 7 switch to alternate color at end of round 11 round 12 repeat round 7 switch back to main color at end of round round 13 repeat round 7 round 14 - 18 * fpdc around next st bpdc around next stitch* around for ribbing some front post stitches will line up with previous row s post stitches and some won t in your first round that s ok work subsequent rounds the same way you work your first round of ribbing black stripes hat in single_crochet and double_crochet worked in the round without joining except ribbing use a stitch marker to note beg of round round 1 using black 6 single_crochet in ring use magic_ring or chain2 and 6sc into first chain round 2 *2sc in each st* around 12sc round 3 *single_crochet in next st 2sc in next st* around 18sc round 4 *single_crochet in next two st 2sc in next st* around 24sc round 5 *single_crochet in next three st 2sc in next st* around 30sc round 6 *single_crochet in next four st 2sc in next st* around 36sc round 7 *single_crochet in next five
